posts.post_content: A four mana [Mana Drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Drain) with upside seems fair somehow. ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) is a steep cost for a counterspell, but making it a hard counter and giving you mana for your next turn just seems... right.

Posted By: Continue (4/23/2013 5:38:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Four mana is a lot, especially when they are all colored mana. That said, the boost from a successful cast of this spell is better than Mana Drain since you actually get to add mana of any color combination into your manapool instead of just colorless mana.  
  
Run this with Noble Hierarch or Birds of Paradise to ensure a better chance of casting it.
posts.html:
Four mana is a lot, especially when they are all colored mana. That said, the boost from a successful cast of this spell is better than Mana Drain since you actually get to add mana of any color combination into your manapool instead of just colorless mana.

Run this with Noble Hierarch or Birds of Paradise to ensure a better chance of casting it.

posts.post_content:
This is what [Mana Drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Drain) should have been from the start. ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) for the counter, ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) for the mana, and a color-intensive cost that prevents it from being better than [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell).  
As it stands, this looks set to be another sweet counterspell for Simic decks, less efficient than [Voidslime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voidslime) but miles ahead of [Mystic Genesis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mystic Genesis).
posts.html:
This is what Mana Drain should have been from the start. for the counter, for the mana, and a color-intensive cost that prevents it from being better than Counterspell.
As it stands, this looks set to be another sweet counterspell for Simic decks, less efficient than Voidslime but miles ahead of Mystic Genesis.

Posted By: Conservator (5/20/2013 6:02:12 PM)

posts.post_content:
Seems a little arrogant of Vorel to be talking down to Niv-Mizzet, who's... You know... The most arrogant being in existence.  
  
Regardless, this is probably one of those rare occasions when a counter spell would be considered for EDH. Counter spells are not usually a good idea, since you usually can't determine what spells they're playing and which spell is the most dangerous (EG: Would you counter a [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation)? What if they're holding a [Living Death](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living Death) or a [Yawgmoth's Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Will)? Do you know what's coming next?).  
  
However, even if you don't counter the most dangerous spell, you're still usually getting your mana back. And since no one's going to waste a space in their EDH deck, countering a spell will always foil someone's plan.
posts.html:

Regardless, this is probably one of those rare occasions when a counter spell would be considered for EDH. Counter spells are not usually a good idea, since you usually can't determine what spells they're playing and which spell is the most dangerous (EG: Would you counter a Damnation? What if they're holding a Living Death or a Yawgmoth's Will? Do you know what's coming next?).

However, even if you don't counter the most dangerous spell, you're still usually getting your mana back. And since no one's going to waste a space in their EDH deck, countering a spell will always foil someone's plan.

posts.post_content:
[Lord of the Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Pit)  
[Urza's Rage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urza's Rage)  
[Chain Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chain Lightning) (de facto)  
[Entomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entomb) (de ditto)  
  
does anyone else already look forward to the potential for this card to get reprinted in a place that essentially dubs it 'Pseudo-Mythic Rarity'? True, Urza's Rage is not really a Mythic by any scale except flavor, but Chain Lightning isn't -any- kind of Rare, yet let's be honest. Chain Lightning is totally the Mythic Rare of *Premium Deck Seies: Fire & Lightning*. So what do you all think?   
  
Chances of gaining a Reprint? 100%  
Chances of gaining a Red Set Symbol? less than 10%  
Chances of being a 'Pseudo-Mythic'? depends on the kind of reprint?

"The opponent might be more than a little suspicious if you are untapped and blue and refrain from playing juicy fatties."

Posted By: talcumpowder0046 (4/28/2013 1:01:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card won us our second Two-Headed Giant game.  
  
I had a U/G/R deck. It was past turn ten, and still didn't have any mountains. Then I draw this.  
  
Ohohoho.  
  
They try to cast a [Carnage Gladiator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnage Gladiator) (which my buddy had already bounced, we knew it existed), then I counter it. They can't do anything because of my [Species Gorger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Species Gorger) out. Then they pass.  
  
I get out all my red stuff, like a [Zhur-Taa Druid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhur-Taa Druid) and a [Rubblebelt Maaka](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rubblebelt Maaka), and have mana left over for [Armed // Dangerous](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armed // Dangerous).  
  
(Btw, the way we won was by [Breaking // Entering](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breaking // Entering) their Gladiator, then [Progenitor Mimic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitor Mimic) on their [Zhur-Taa Swine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhur-Taa Swine). What? He was going Grixis control. We expect THEM to bring our swords for us.)
posts.html:

(Btw, the way we won was by Breaking // Entering their Gladiator, then Progenitor Mimic on their Zhur-Taa Swine. What? He was going Grixis control. We expect THEM to bring our swords for us.)
